content.raw: I tested it out with @caguero and it looks like the examples compile well without it. We thought it may be best to leave it here though, since the examples explicitly include ign-common headers
content.html: I tested it out with @caguero and it looks like the examples compile well without it. We thought it may be best to leave it here though, since the examples explicitly include ign-common headers

content.raw: it depends if the GUI library is exporting its common dependency or just linking to it privately
content.html: it depends if the GUI library is exporting its common dependency or just linking to it privately
Release tools PR fixes the Xenial build:

content.raw: Wasn't there a way in to make ign-gui's dependencies be automatically exported so that `find_package(ignition-gui...)` brings the dependencies?
content.html: Wasn't there a way in to make ign-gui's dependencies be automatically exported so that find_package(ignition-gui...) brings the dependencies?

content.raw: I just removed it in 253027e. I think is better the include to hide this detail. This reminds me that we should create a header in our Ignition repos with just forward declarations. This might be a solution for these situations.
content.html: I just removed it in 253027e. I think is better the include to hide this detail. This reminds me that we should create a header in our Ignition repos with just forward declarations. This might be a solution for these situations.

content.raw: They shouldn’t. How about replacing the forward declaration with an include of the `MessageInfo` header instead? Avoiding forward declarations is recommended by the [google style guide](https://google.github.io/styleguide/cppguide.html#Forward_Declarations). If the include is significantly increasing compile time then maybe `OnMessage()` should be moved to the private implementation.
content.html: They shouldn’t. How about replacing the forward declaration with an include of the MessageInfo header instead? Avoiding forward declarations is recommended by the google style guide. If the include is significantly increasing compile time then maybe OnMessage() should be moved to the private implementation.
